So Ethereum was struggling to move above EMA55 but it has never traded above EMA89 after a major low since late June 2025, almost seven months ago.

EMA89 was tested with a rejection 6-January but this level broke as resistance yesterday and there you have your confirmation for a massive wave. The confirmation already came from Bitcoin and hundreds of altcoins, we looked at hundreds of charts but here we have it again from the Queen itself‚Äî#2. How good can it get?

We are looking at Monero going ballistic and we saw what happened with Zcash. These are not normal movements these are extraordinary feats. We saw this same dynamic happening with many other smaller projects, growth beyond 3,000%. These are too small to mention but it is happening; bull market type of bullish action. For Ethereum, what can we expect?

The whole introduction is just to say that we can expect a strong bullish wave. Like I mentioned in a recent article, I don't think we peak below ATH, I don't think Ether will remain as a lower high and let everybody down with a lack of massive growth. No bull run for Ethereum and then a bear market? I don't know, I don't think so.

I think Ethereum is Crypto and Crypto is awesome. Ethereum will do whatever it needs to do to make up for all the hardships we went through when the market was down. It will make it all up to us with a massive bullish run.

ETHUSDT is now trading above EMA89 on the daily timeframe with a bullish MACD and strong RSI. Still moving as a lower high compared to 10-December 2025. The peak then was $3,444.44. I'll tell you why this level is yet to break.

All the stop-loss orders for the bears are set right above this level. Many have their systems running on auto-pilot while others are praying that for some reason the market will reverse. Thus the market continues slow for a surprise move.

Coming to Arbitrum: Smoother Fees, Higher Throughput

The new ArbOS Dia upgrade will bring users, builders, and operators:

- More predictable gas prices on Arbitrum
- Improved mobile & enterprise-grade auth tools
- Ethereum Fusaka support

Here‚Äôs the rundown üëá 
Gas prices shouldn‚Äôt feel like rideshare surge pricing.

With the Dia upgrade, Arbitrum will get:

- Pricing changes to smooth gas spikes (and how long they last)
- A higher minimum L2 base fee to balance DAO revenue & make spam more expensive

Result: more predictable fees when the network gets busy.
Dia will lay the foundation for Dynamic Pricing.

In a first-of-its-kind approach, Arbitrum will start tracking gas across multiple resources like compute, storage access, storage growth, and history growth instead of just one total.

This is a major unlock: over time, this is how you safely push much higher throughput (like 10x higher gas targets) out of existing operator hardware.
Onboarding shouldn‚Äôt feel like an initiation ritual.

With strengthened support for secp256r1, Dia will give builders:

- Passkey-style authentication
- Face ID / fingerprint signing patterns
- Device-secured keys & mobile keystores
- Enterprise flows like corporate IDPs and 2FA-backed recovery

In short: mobile-native onboarding users know and love
Dia also expands what‚Äôs possible for Arbitrum chains.

With Native Token Mint/Burn, Arbitrum chains can use interoperability-enabled token standards like LayerZero OFTs, xERC20s, native USDC, and native USDT (USDT0) as gas tokens by delegating mint/burn capabilities to a trusted bridge.

That means: more gas token options for chain operators
Under the hood, Dia also pulls in Fusaka-era execution changes that matter for Arbitrum:

- A new CLZ opcode (EIP-7939)
- Safer, repriced ModExp (EIP-7823, EIP-7883)
- Properly enabled BLS12-381 precompiles (EIP-2537)
- Plus the new eth_config RPC method (EIP-7910)

The goal: keep Arbitrum Ethereum-aligned.
ArbOS Dia is planned to launch early January 2026.

If you care about smoother fees, higher throughput, and modern onboarding users know and love, this is the upgrade to follow.

Ethereum‚Äôs London Hard Fork (Aug 2021) didn‚Äôt look flashy at the time, but it quietly changed everything.

EIP-1559 replaced the messy gas auction with a predictable base fee + optional tip, making transactions easier and less stressful. The base fee is burned, introducing real deflationary pressure on ETH during high network activity.

London also delayed the difficulty bomb, giving devs time to finish the move to Proof of Stake ‚Äî which finally happened with the Merge in 2022.

No hype. Just smart design that reshaped Ethereum‚Äôs economics, UX, and long-term sustainability.

User swapped $30M and got MORE than expected‚ö°Ô∏è

User initiated: 323 BTC ‚Üí ETH swap ($30M+) 
THORChain pools had approximately: ~2,500 ETH

Not nearly enough liquidity for a single massive swap.

The Solution: Streaming Swaps + Arbitrage

Instead of one trade that would destroy the price, the swap was broken into 3,608 smaller swaps executed every 2 THORChain blocks over 13 hours.

Why every 2 blocks instead of every block?

@SwapKitPowered (the integration toolkit that @TrustWallet uses to connect to THORChain) chose this interval to give arbitrage bots enough time to:

1. Spot the price difference on THORChain
2. Buy cheaper assets elsewhere
3. Add liquidity to THORChain pools
4. Profit from the price gap

The protocol incentivizes arb bots to become the liquidity exactly when it's needed.

Quote (including all fees): 9,192.55 ETH
Actually received: 9,240.64 ETH

User got 48 MORE ETH than quoted.

During the 13 hour swap, ETH/BTC price dropped 1.93% on external markets. The streaming execution captured this price movement in the user's favor.

Most DEXs and bridges fail at scale because they're limited to whatever liquidity sits in their pools.

THORChain's design makes arbitrage profitable, so bots automatically provide liquidity exactly when needed. The bigger the swap, the more profitable the arb, the faster pools get rebalanced.
